column4: Anyone know about totem? its just I assume that at some point it has worked for someone, but I've never actually seen it play a file - it always says the plugin isn't available or something
for most media files at the moment you need to install totem-xine unfortunately
that does however move your install into the unsupported configuration
ah, well thatsok, I was just using xine before anyway
totem-xine plays everything mplayer does for me
ah well thats good... then they should support xine. Cos totem on its own really doesn't seem to play anything at all, even plain mpeg1...which makes me wonder what it DOES play ;)
should play basic non copyrighted codecs in theory :P
support for the gstreamer stuff is being worked on, it needs alot of work at the moment
yeh it doesnt really do that much
bu it means officially your system is "unsupported"
ubuntu-desktop is just a meta-package which depends on the base install configuration
and is removed if you stray from it
only real problem that causes is in future upgrades sometimes they add packages to it
to force them to install in an upgrade
so every so often i apt-get install ubuntu-desktop and see what deps its trying to bring in and install those manually
